name.en: The Intersection of Taiwanese History and East Asian History
name.ch: 台灣史與東亞史的交錯

goal.ch:
East Asia has been compelled to confront military, political, economic, social, and cultural pressures and challenges imposed by Western Imperialism since the 19th century. Each country and region in the area has devised its own approach to respond to these challenges and pressures. Consequently, East Asia has internalized these challenges and pressures, shaping them into driving forces, obstacles, and limitations in the historical process of development. 
    The course will apply Flipped Classroom Approach which Encourages students to take an active role in learning by conducting research prior to class. The students enrolled in the course will research a chosen historical event using Wikipedia and ChatGPT in different languages for encouraging then to critically evaluate historical sources in multiple languages, considering discrepancies and biases. The lecturer then elaborates on the historical background based on the content of this report, and invites the students responsible for the report to discuss the controversial parts in the last hour of the course. This discussion will also be open to all students taking the course.

gradMethod.ch:
1.Attendance: 20％
Active engagement in class discussions is essential, especially in evaluating historical controversies.
2.Preparation and Presentation (30％):
Students will research a chosen historical event using Wikipedia and ChatGPT in different languages.
Present findings during the first hour of class, focusing on discrepancies between sources in English, Chinese, Japanese, or other languages.
3.Final Oral presentation or performance (Group): 50％
The topic should be explored under a micro perspective. Any group can choice any topic related to each lecture of the course or innovated by any kind of creative idea.
The style of the Final Oral presentation or performance will not limited in any specific approach.
